Yes, Delta Air Lines has implemented several policies and procedures to ensure the safety of its passengers and employees during the COVID-19 pandemic. Here are some of them:

1. Enhanced Cleaning: Delta Air Lines has implemented enhanced cleaning protocols across its aircraft and facilities, with a focus on high-touch surfaces such as tray tables, seat belts, and lavatories.

2. Social Distancing: Delta Air Lines is enforcing social distancing measures in airports and during the boarding process. The airline has also implemented a "middle seat" blocking policy, which limits the number of passengers on each flight to allow for greater distance between passengers.

3. Facemask Requirement: Delta Air Lines requires all passengers and employees to wear face masks or coverings while on board its aircraft or in its facilities. The requirement applies to all passengers over the age of two.

4. HEPA Filters: Delta Air Lines uses high-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters on its aircraft, which are designed to trap airborne particles and ensure high-quality air circulation.

5. Limited Food and Beverage Service: Delta Air Lines has limited its food and beverage service to reduce the risk of transmission. Passengers may be able to purchase pre-packaged snacks and drinks, but in-flight meals are generally suspended or limited.

These policies and procedures are designed to reduce the risk of transmission of COVID-19 among passengers and employees while still allowing for essential travel. Delta Air Lines continues to evaluate and update its policies based on the latest public health guidance and scientific research.
